author: _shemnon
content: Identical contracts can be deployed multiple times with different state.

author: maxandrew
content: Yeah arenâ€™t we just duplicating a lot of stuff like functions by doing it that way though?

author: maxandrew
content: Particularly assuming thereâ€™s some way to create multiple instances of state without the need for an entire contract to be duplicated

author: _shemnon
content: Accounts store a code hash, not the code itself.  So duplicate contracts are not duplicates in storage.  Each contract account basically has a content addressable pointer to the code, so it only needs to be stored and validated once.

author: maxandrew
content: So itâ€™s basically all a hash table anyway?

author: _shemnon
content: A cryptographically secure hash table, with cryptographic level hash collision resistance.  So a really fancy hash table.
